SupportingEvidence: Strong mesenchymal/ECM program (MATN3, BGN, LAMC1, ITGA8, PLAT) and TGFB2 suggesting EMT and stromal differentiation
Wnt/β-catenin feedback targets (APCDD1, NKD1, ZNRF3) consistent with canonical HB signaling
Developmental/morphogenetic factors (BMP4, PTN) and guidance receptors (ROBO1, NRP2) typical of progenitor-like mixed epithelial–mesenchymal states
Divergent differentiation signals (MYH7B muscle, CHGB/SERPINI1 neuroendocrine/neuronal) argue against purely fetal or embryonal epithelial identity
SuggestedExperiments: IHC/IF for epithelial (EPCAM, KRT8/18) and mesenchymal/chondroid markers (VIM, MATN3, SOX9, COL2A1)
β-catenin localization (nuclear IHC) and Wnt target readouts (AXIN2, GLUL, APCDD1/NKD1 by qPCR/ISH)
Assess TGF-β activity (pSMAD2/3 IHC) and ECM deposition (LAMC1, BGN)
Evaluate ROBO1/NRP2 and angiogenesis markers (CD34) spatially
Functional assays: tumorsphere formation and migration/invasion to confirm progenitor/EMT features
